1.brief: properly, assemblage; used only adverbially also, even, yea, though; often repeated as correl. both...and
properly, a pithy maxim, usually of metaphorical nature; hence, a simile (as an adage, poem, discourse)
who, which, what, that; also (as an adverb and a conjunction) when, where, how, because, in order that, etc.
to remove (intransitive or transitive) figuratively, to grow old; specifically, to transcribe
a man as an individual or a male person; often used as an adjunct to a more definite term (and in such cases frequently not expressed in translation)
Chizkijah, a king of Judah, also the name of two other Israelites
Jehudah (or Judah), the name of five Israelites; also of the tribe descended from the first, and of its territory

2.brief: properly, weight, but only figuratively in a good sense, splendor or copiousness

gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative
to hide (by covering), literally or figuratively
a word; by implication, a matter (as spoken of) or thing; adverbially, a cause
properly, weight, but only figuratively in a good sense, splendor or copiousness
properly, to penetrate; hence, to examine intimately
a word; by implication, a matter (as spoken of) or thing; adverbially, a cause

3.brief: the sky (as aloft; the dual perhaps alluding to the visible arch in which the clouds move, as well as to the higher ether where the celestial bodies revolve)
the earth (at large, or partitively a land)
the heart; also used (figuratively) very widely for the feelings, the will and even the intellect; likewise for the centre of anything
a non-entity; generally used as a negative particle

4.brief: silver (from its pale color); by implication, money
to go (causatively, bring) out, in a great variety of applications, literally and figuratively, direct and proxim.
to fuse (metal), i.e. refine (literally or figuratively)
something prepared, i.e. any apparatus (as an implement, utensil, dress, vessel or weapon)

5.brief: morally wrong; concretely, an (actively) bad person
the face (as the part that turns); used in a great variety of applications (literally and figuratively); also (with prepositional prefix) as a preposition (before, etc.)

properly, to be erect (i.e. stand perpendicular); hence (causatively) to set up, in a great variety of applications, whether literal (establish, fix, prepare, apply), or figurative (appoint, render sure, proper or prosperous)
the right (natural, moral or legal); also (abstractly) equity or (figuratively) prosperity
properly, covered, i.e. a throne (as canopied)

6.brief: not (the qualified negation, used as a deprecative); once (Job 24:25) as a noun, nothing
to swell up (literally or figuratively, active or passive); by implication, to favor or honour, be high or proud
the face (as the part that turns); used in a great variety of applications (literally and figuratively); also (with prepositional prefix) as a preposition (before, etc.)
properly, a standing, i.e. a spot; but used widely of a locality (general or specific); also (figuratively) of a condition (of body or mind)
great (in any sense); hence, older; also insolent
not (the qualified negation, used as a deprecative); once (Job 24:25) as a noun, nothing
to stand, in various relations (literal and figurative, intransitive and transitive)

7.brief: (by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed

good (as an adjective) in the widest sense; used likewise as a noun, both in the masculine and the feminine, the singular and the plural (good, a good or good thing, a good man or woman; the good, goods or good things, good men or women), also as an adverb (well)
to ascend, intransitively (be high) or actively (mount); used in a great variety of senses, primary and secondary, literal and figurative
hither or thither (but used both of place and time)
to depress or sink (expectation figuratively, to humiliate, intransitive or transitive)
the face (as the part that turns); used in a great variety of applications (literally and figuratively); also (with prepositional prefix) as a preposition (before, etc.)
properly, voluntary, i.e. generous; hence, magnanimous; as noun, a grandee (sometimes a tyrant)
who, which, what, that; also (as an adverb and a conjunction) when, where, how, because, in order that, etc.
to see, literally or figuratively (in numerous applications, direct and implied, transitive, intransitive and causative)
an eye (literally or figuratively); by analogy, a fountain (as the eye of the landscape)

8.brief: not (the qualified negation, used as a deprecative); once (Job 24:25) as a noun, nothing
to go (causatively, bring) out, in a great variety of applications, literally and figuratively, direct and proxim.
properly, to toss, i.e. grapple; mostly figuratively, to wrangle, i.e. hold a controversy; (by implication) to defend
properly, removal; used only (in the construction) adverb as conjunction, lest

properly, interrogative what? (including how? why? when?); but also exclamation, what! (including how!), or indefinitely what (including whatever, and even relatively, that which); often used with prefixes in various adverbial or conjunctive senses
to do or make, in the broadest sense and widest application
the last or end, hence, the future; also posterity
properly, to wound; but only figuratively, to taunt or insult
properly, self (but generally used to point out more definitely the object of a verb or preposition, even or namely)

9.brief: properly, to toss, i.e. grapple; mostly figuratively, to wrangle, i.e. hold a controversy; (by implication) to defend
properly, nearness (used only as a preposition or an adverb), near; hence, generally, with, by, at, among, etc.
a session, i.e. company of persons (in close deliberation); by implication, intimacy, consultation, a secret
properly, hinder; generally, next, other, etc.
not (the qualified negation, used as a deprecative); once (Job 24:25) as a noun, nothing
to denude (especially in a disgraceful sense); by implication, to exile (captives being usually stripped); figuratively, to reveal

10.brief: properly, removal; used only (in the construction) adverb as conjunction, lest
properly, perhaps to bow (the neck only  in courtesy to an equal), i.e. to be kind; also (by euphemistically, but rarely) to reprove
to hear intelligently (often with implication of attention, obedience, etc.; causatively, to tell, etc.)
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to turn back (hence, away) transitively or intransitively, literally or figuratively (not necessarily with the idea of return to the starting point); generally to retreat; often adverbial, again

11.brief: an apple (from its fragrance), i.e. the fruit or the tree (probably includ. others of the pome order, as the quince, the orange, etc.)
gold, figuratively, something gold-colored (i.e. yellow), as oil, a clear sky
a figure (carved on stone, the wall, or any object); figuratively, imagination
silver (from its pale color); by implication, money
a word; by implication, a matter (as spoken of) or thing; adverbially, a cause
perhaps properly, to arrange; but used figuratively (of words), to speak; rarely (in a destructive sense) to subdue
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications

12.brief: gold, figuratively, something gold-colored (i.e. yellow), as oil, a clear sky
properly, something carved out, i.e. ore; hence, gold (pure as originally mined)
to be right (i.e. correct); reciprocal, to argue; causatively, to decide, justify or convict
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
broadness. i.e. (concrete) the ear (from its form in man)
to hear intelligently (often with implication of attention, obedience, etc.; causatively, to tell, etc.)

13.brief: a hook (as pointed); also a (large) shield (as if guarding by prickliness); also cold (as piercing)
a day (as the warm hours), whether literal (from sunrise to sunset, or from one sunset to the next), or figurative (a space of time defined by an associated term), (often used adverb)
severed, i.e. harvest (as reaped), the crop, the time, the reaper, or figuratively; also a limb (of a tree, or simply foliage)
a hinge (as pressed in turning); also a throe (as a phys. or mental pressure); also a herald or erranddoer (as constrained by the principal)
properly, to build up or support; to foster as a parent or nurse; figuratively to render (or be) firm or faithful, to trust or believe, to be permanent or quiet; morally to be true or certain;
to send away, for, or out (in a great variety of applications)
properly, a breathing creature, i.e. animal of (abstractly) vitality; used very widely in a literal, accommodated or figurative sense (bodily or mental)
to turn back (hence, away) transitively or intransitively, literally or figuratively (not necessarily with the idea of return to the starting point); generally to retreat; often adverbial, again

14.brief: properly, an exalted one, i.e. a king or sheik; also a rising mist

wind; by resemblance breath, i.e. a sensible (or even violent) exhalation; figuratively, life, anger, unsubstantiality; by extension, a region of the sky; by resemblance spirit, but only of a rational being (including its expression and functions)
a non-entity; generally used as a negative particle
a man as an individual or a male person; often used as an adjunct to a more definite term (and in such cases frequently not expressed in translation)
to be clear (orig. of sound, but usually of color); to shine; hence, to make ashow, to boast; and thus to be (clamorously) foolish; to rave; causatively, to celebrate; also to stultify
an untruth; by implication, a sham (often adverbial)

15.brief: properly, the nose or nostril; hence, the face, and occasionally a person; also (from the rapid breathing in passion) ire
to open, i.e. be (causatively, make) roomy; usually figuratively (in a mental or moral sense) to be (causatively, make) simple or (in a sinister way) delude
a magistrate (as deciding) or other leader
the tongue (of man or animals), used literally (as the instrument of licking, eating, or speech), and figuratively (speech, an ingot, a fork of flame, a cove of water)
tender (literally or figuratively); by implication, weak
a bone (as the skeleton of the body); hence, self, i.e. (figuratively) very

16.brief: honey (from its stickiness); by analogy, syrup
properly, to come forth to, i.e. appear or exist; transitively, to attain, i.e. find or acquire; figuratively, to occur, meet or be present
enough (as noun or adverb), used chiefly with preposition in phrases
properly, removal; used only (in the construction) adverb as conjunction, lest
to sate, i.e. fill to satisfaction (literally or figuratively)

17.brief: properly, apparently, to be heavy, i.e. (figuratively) valuable; causatively, to make rare (figuratively, to inhibit)
a foot (as used in walking); by implication, a step; by euphemistically the pudenda
a house (in the greatest variation of applications, especially family, etc.)
properly, removal; used only (in the construction) adverb as conjunction, lest
to sate, i.e. fill to satisfaction (literally or figuratively)

18.brief: drought; also a cutting instrument (from its destructive effect), as a knife, sword, or other sharp implement
properly, a piercer, i.e. an arrow; by implication, a wound; figuratively, (of God) thunderbolt; the shaft of aspear
to point (transitive or intransitive); intensively, to pierce; figuratively, to inculcate
a man as an individual or a male person; often used as an adjunct to a more definite term (and in such cases frequently not expressed in translation)
properly, to eye or (generally) to heed, i.e. pay attention; by implication, to respond; by extension to begin to speak; specifically to sing, shout, testify, announce
concretely, a witness; abstractly, testimony; specifically, a recorder, i.e. prince
an untruth; by implication, a sham (often adverbial)

19.brief: a tooth (as sharp); specifically  ivory; figuratively, a cliff
a foot (as used in walking); by implication, a step; by euphemistically the pudenda
properly, made to slip, i.e. dislocated
properly, a refuge, i.e. (objective) security, or (subjective) assurance
to cover (with a garment); figuratively, to act covertly; by implication, to pillage
a day (as the warm hours), whether literal (from sunrise to sunset, or from one sunset to the next), or figurative (a space of time defined by an associated term), (often used adverb)
tightness (i.e. figuratively, trouble); transitively, a female rival:

a covering, i.e. clothing; also treachery or pillage
a day (as the warm hours), whether literal (from sunrise to sunset, or from one sunset to the next), or figurative (a space of time defined by an associated term), (often used adverb)
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
mineral potash (so called from effervescing with acid)

the heart; also used (figuratively) very widely for the feelings, the will and even the intellect; likewise for the centre of anything
bad or (as noun) evil (natural or moral)

21.brief: used very widely as demonstrative, lo!; interrogative, whether?; or conditional, if, although; also Oh that!, when; hence, as a negative, not
food (for man or beast), especially bread, or grain (for making it)
used very widely as demonstrative, lo!; interrogative, whether?; or conditional, if, although; also Oh that!, when; hence, as a negative, not
to quaff, i.e. (causatively) to irrigate or furnish apotion to
water; figuratively, juice; by euphemism, urine, semen

thou and thee, or (plural) ye and you
to lay hold of; especially to pick up fire

Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
to be safe (in mind, body or estate); figuratively, to be (causatively, make) completed; by implication, to be friendly; by extension, to reciprocate (in various applications)

properly, hidden, i.e. dark; used only of the north as aquarter (gloomy and unknown)
